pullRequest.title: Update release guide with extended information.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Please add a meaningful description for your change here

Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 Choose reviewer(s) and mention them in a comment (R: @username).
 Format the pull request title like [BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles, where you replace BEAM-XXX with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 If this contribution is large, please file an Apache Individual Contributor License Agreement.

See the Contributor Guide for more tips on how to make review process smoother.

commit.message: Update release guide with extended information.
Add link to mass comment script

nodes.bodyText: This worked fine for me. What was the issue for you?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -125,7 +125,7 @@ __NOTE__: When generating the key, please make sure you choose the key type as _
 
 * Determine your Apache GPG Key and Key ID, as follows:
 
-      gpg --list-keys

nodes.bodyText: I also had issues with figuring this out, but it is written already in line 588 above. Not sure if it's worth repeating so close by.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -595,6 +600,9 @@ For this step, we recommend you using automation script to create a RC, but you
   1. Update last release download links in `website/src/get-started/downloads.md`.
   1. Update `website/src/.htaccess` to redirect to the new version.
   1. Build and stage python wheels.
+  1. Public staging artifacts

nodes.bodyText:
For brevity, could this just say: "use pip install twine to install twine locally or in a virtualenv of your choice"?
Otherwise, I'd also write down to deactivate and clean up env/ when done.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1248,6 +1256,14 @@ please follow [the guide](https://help.github.com/articles/creating-a-personal-a
    delete the `.asc`, `.sha512`;
 3. Upload the new release `twine upload *` from the directory with the `.zip` and `.whl` files;
 
+[Installing twine](https://packaging.python.org/tutorials/packaging-projects/):
+```
+virtualenv env
+. ./env/bin/activate

nodes.bodyText:
This will install twine globally. This works but it may not be what people want.
suggestion -> install twine in a virtualenv.
